textList.name: TEXT_FREE_CRYSTAL
textList.text: You notice the barebones wreckage of a nearby Crystalline vessel; though little scrap matter remains, it appears the scavengers overlooked a single Crystal weapon!
A small Crystalline trader with a squeaky high-pitched voice hails you. "Foreigners! It is important we make peace with barbaric aliens, perhaps this free weapon of war will soothe you?"

A Crystalline trading outpost hails you, requesting a trade. You look through your supply count until you realise their offer is a sample of foreign rocks in return for a military grade weapon... an offer you take in a heartbeat.

event.name: CRYSTAL_FOREIGNER_MAP
event.text: You notice another foreigner nearby, a ship of scout classification. They hail you and make a brief offer to sell you the map data they have been collecting from this sector.

choice.text: We can't verify the quality of their maps. Decline.

event.text: You decline the scout's offer and carry on.
The ship transfers over the map data to your ship's computer.
The ship transfers over the map data to your ship's computer.

You briefly inspect the map but are confused as to what you're seeing. The data is warbled, and in many spots it's obviously incorrect. You doubt they intentionally scammed you, but this data is worthless!
"What! Those maps are perfectly fine. We aren't refunding you for perfectly good data!"
You arm the weapons and prepare to force the refund out of them, one way or another.

choice.text: (Mind Control) 'Convince' them to give a full refund.

event.text: "You are right. These are bad maps. You deserve your money back. I am very ashamed of myself. Boo hoo."

choice.text: (Mind Control Weapon) 'Convince' them to give a full refund.

event.text: "You are right. These are bad maps. You deserve your money back. I am very ashamed of myself. Boo hoo."

event.name: CRYSTAL_CACHE_MV
event.text: Odd radar pings from a huge, orbiting asteroid here reveal a Crystalline cache of some kind. A deep crater has been sealed over with a thick layer of crystal to keep whatever's inside safe - it'd take some serious firepower to break though.

choice.text: Attempt to break through with the weapons you have.

event.text: Your powerful weapon dislodges and shatters a massive shard of crystal, leaving enough space to send an away team to climb down and take a look.

choice.text: This was a fantastic display of firepower, but who is going to investigate in there?

event.text: You ignore the cache and do something onboard the ship.

choice.text: (Crystal Crew) Have your Crystal crew recalibrate your weapons.

event.text: Your Crystalline crew-member is able to adjust the detonation frequency of your weapons to resonate with this type of crystal, and the barrier gives little resistance.
You ignore the cache and do something onboard the ship.
You fire everything you have, but the crystal barrier remains strong. After a time you give up and move on.
You fire everything you have, but the crystal barrier remains strong. After a time you give up and move on.
Against all odds, a lucky shot strikes an existing fracture in the crystal, compounding it into a crack that grows until an entire section of the barrier falls away!

choice.text: Unfortunately for you, luck cannot change the fact that you have no one to send to investigate the cache.

event.text: You ignore the cache and do something onboard the ship.
On arriving at the base of the crater, your team discovers a long-forgotten weapons cache. Most of the equipment is out of action, but not all of it!
Your away team is greeted at the crater by the owners of the cache, who are none too happy. You grab what you can and run back to the ship, but not before they teleport aboard!

You send a crewmember down to check out the cache. The comm goes dead, and shortly thereafter massive gravity readings are detected on the asteroid. You must have triggered some kind of singularity booby trap! We've got to leave now before we're pulled in!

You push the impulse engines to their limit and are able to break out of the gravity well. Your crewmember, along with the stockpile, is reduced to the size of a tennis ball - but you're left in one piece.

removeCrew.text: Luckily, your Clone Bay is able to revive your crewmember.

choice.text: Detonate your entire fuel reserves to escape with your crew and the cargo.

event.text: You swoop into the heart of the distortion and pick up your crewmember and the cargo. You then eject your FTL fuel and ignite it, sending a shock wave that thrusts your ship well beyond the event horizon of the singularity. That was close.

choice.text: (Upg. Teleporter) Beam your crewmember back on board.

event.text: You floor the engines to escape the gravity well while trying to get a teleporter lock on your crewmember despite the massive interference. You're barely able to get them back on board before the entire area is consumed into the singularity.

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Rescue your crewmember and the cargo.

event.text: You swoop into the heart of the distortion and pick up your crewmember and the cargo. Your top of the line impulse engines are barely able to get your ship out of the gravity well before the whole ship is consumed. That was close.

event.name: CRYSTAL_SCRAP_EXCITED_MV
event.text: You receive a signal from a private relay on a nearby inhabited planet. "Oh goodness, an Alien vessel! I was wondering how long until I would see one now that we've left the homeworlds! Please, I am a collector of many artifacts, I'm sure what is scrap to you is priceless to me."
"My word! Is this... a 25th century Rockman thrust stabilizer?! What do you want for it? Wait, I have a better proposal. I long to see the galaxy. I propose I come with you. What do you say?"
"I shan't even gather my belongings - only permit me to leave my family a message." The Crystalline being joins your crew.
Scrap is priceless no matter where you are in the galaxy. You hold onto your goods and prepare to jump.
"Very well, a payment in kind. I have these explosives that emulate our race's innate ability. Perhaps that would interest you."
"Very well, a payment in kind. I have an extra ship weapon laying around here somewhere. Perhaps you could make use of it?"

event.name: CRYSTAL_HUMAN_TESTS_MV
event.text: You arrive near what appears to be a Crystalline research facility. A scientist quickly messages you, "Ah! Some more aliens. Please, I've heard so much about all the different races in this galaxy and I am really curious about your physiology! Would you let us run a few simple tests?"

choice.text: Allow them to run tests on a crewmember.
The scientists will have to look elsewhere for test subjects.

event.text: "I see. That is a shame. Perhaps the next vessel we meet will be able to contribute to the advancement of science."

"Ah! My dear evolutionary cousin! This is truly wonderful! We have countless historical records of your kind but we lack information on the past few hundreds of years. We can learn so much from these scans, we must get to analyzing them as soon as possible! Please, take this."

"Is that... ? Impossible... The lost sister species to Crystal and Rock kind! This is truly wonderful! We have so little records of the Salty Ones. We have a lot to learn from these scans, we must get to analyzing them as soon as possible! Please, take this."
"Oh... you're one of us. I'm afraid you must not have understood. I asked for an alien volunteer. I have no need for one of my own." They cut comms.

choice.text: (Backup DNA Bank) Send your crew's data.

event.text: "What is this? Full genetic and personal profiles stored digitally? I did not think this possible... This will help our research immeasurably. Please, take this in exchange for your help."

After a short time the scientist returns, "We... must regret... we have made a grave miscalculation. Your bodies are considerably more fragile than we expected and your companion is... broken. We apologize and offer a fine military-grade weapon as consolation."

removeCrew.text: You accept their apology and decide it's better not to mention that your Clone Bay is in the process of reviving the lost crewmember.

event.text: Your crewmember is brought on board their station and forced to undergo a few quick scans and tests. "Thank you for this opportunity! We hope to learn much from your kind." They transfer some supplies as payment.

The large Crystalline Beings escort your crew onto the station and gingerly help them into a scanning chamber. After a few seconds, they inform you they have mapped their entire genome and have everything they need. They give you a schematic as compensation.
"I see. That is a shame. Perhaps the next aliens we meet will have some respect for the advancement of science."
"I see. That is a shame. Perhaps the next aliens we meet will have some respect for the advancement of science."
"I see. That is a shame. However we must not let this opportunity pass us by. Submit and you will be treated reasonably well!" A military ship docked nearby detaches and charges you.

event.name: CRYSTAL_CHATTY_MV
event.text: A small civilian vessel messages you, "Wow! You're one of the Federation, aren't you! Are you busy? Can I ask you a question?"
"What do you eat? What is your culture like? How long do your people live?"
"I see. Oh well. Maybe the next alien I meet will be nicer..." You prepare to jump.
"I see... I guess you're busy."

choice.text: (Crystal Crew) Have your crew speak to them.

event.text: "Wow, you're one of us! I didn't know we already made an alliance with the Federation. I guess I won't bother you, but here, have some of our extra supplies!"

You speak at length about nothing particularly interesting. "Wow, thanks. Oh look, another alien ship! I wonder if they're as nice as you." Seeing the Rebel decals you doubt they're friendly. They spot you and move in to attack, while the Crystalline civilian jumps away.

You speak at length about nothing particularly interesting. "Wow, thanks! I don't know if this is of any use to you, but we have some supplies we can offer you. Perhaps you can use them on your trip!"
You speak at length about nothing particularly interesting. "Wow, thanks! Perhaps we can fix up a bit of your hull for sating my curiosity. We're pretty handy with repairs."

event.name: CRYSTAL_MONTY
event.text: As you arrive at this beacon, you are stopped by a Crystalline vessel. "Stop! Who would cross the beacon of death must answer me these questions three, ere the other side he see."

choice.text: Ask me the questions. I am not afraid.

event.text: "What... is your name?"
"What... is your quest?"

choice.text: We don't have time for this, attack!

event.text: You ignore the Crystal's questions and attack!
"What... is the name of the Mantis queen?"
"What... is the name of the grand Orchid Gardens?"

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) The answer is Rt'lak Et.

event.text: "What... is the name of the Zoltan religion?"

choice.text: The Church of the Great Eye.

event.name: CRYSTAL_MONTY_CORRECT
event.text: "Right. Off you go!" The Crystals wave you past. As you leave, you find the wreckage of several ships who failed the test before you. You feel a little guilty about it, but you don't waste the opportunity and scrap the ships.

event.name: CRYSTAL_MONTY_INCORRECT
event.text: "Hee hee, wrong!" The Crystal fires a large shard from one of their weapons straight into the ships hull, and moves in to attack.

event.name: CRYSTAL_MONTY_UNKNOWN
event.text: "Oh well!" The Crystals move in to attack.

event.name: CRYSTAL_AUTO_SURVEYOR
event.text: An Auto-Surveyor vessel is patrolling the nearby area, likely sent by the Rebels to scout out the new Crystal territory.

choice.text: Attack the ship, if we can get its black box we can download the data!

event.text: You prepare to engage the automated vessel.
You successfully download the data without alerting the ship.

choice.text: (Hacking Weapon) Jam its sensors and download its data.

event.text: You successfully download the data while the ship tries to get its sensors back online.
The ship poses no interest to you.

event.name: CRYSTAL_TORTURE
event.text: This beacon welcomes you with a gruesome and unnerving sight. A Crystalline station has several different creatures embedded in its hull, slowly suffocating or crushed under the weight of the crystalline plating.
"Ah, so you wish to join the likes of these pitiful creatures? Let it be so!"
The station doesn't attempt to contact you as your FTL charges.
While scrapping the station, you notice that the crew encased in the ship are still barely alive... but they won't for long.
The Medbay heals their wounds, but it cannot bring them back from the dead. Many of the ex-prisoners do not make it, but one lucky soul was able to be revived.

choice.text: There's too little we can do to help.

event.name: CRYSTAL_REBEL_CRYSTAL_MV
event.text: Crystal shards fly past the screen as soon as you arrive. Checking the scanners, it looks like a Crystalline ship is engaged with a Rebel!
You message the Crystalline ship your intentions and move in to intercept the Rebel ship.

You move in to intercept the Crystalline ship. As soon as the Rebel scans your ship it takes the opportunity to jump. You have the sneaking suspicion they will inform the fleet of your position, but that's the least of your current concerns.
With the two ships engaged in combat, you sneak by unnoticed.

event.name: CRYSTAL_REBEL_CRYSTAL2_MV
event.text: You're greeted by an unwelcome sight - a Rebel advance ship is laying down fire on a Crystalline vessel in the distance.

Before you can engage, the Crystalline ship scores a direct hit and obliterates the Rebel ship! They hail: "You, you are like these other aliens! You brought them here!" With that they turn their cannons on you!
It's best to take advantage of the rare occasions when the Rebels aren't shooting at you. You prepare to jump.

event.name: CRYSTAL_MANTIS_CRYSTAL_MV
event.text: You discover a number of civilian ships fleeing the area. Shots are fired and you find the assailant; a Mantis ship is attacking one of the smaller ships!
You activate your impulse engines and fly between the Mantis and their prey, weapons charging. You appear to have their full attention.
You try to keep a low profile and quickly prepare to jump.

event.name: CRYSTAL_PIRATE_CRYSTAL_MV
event.text: A pirate ship jumps in right after you arrive at the beacon. It almost charges a small Crystalline transport ship, weapons armed.
You chase down the pirate before it has a chance to engage the civilian ship. When it detects the real threat, it turns to face you.
You assume the Crystalline ship can handle itself. You have enough of your own problems.
You contact the Crystalline ship to hear, "We never should have returned. All around us, there is war and chaos. Do not speak to us again." They cut communications.
The Crystalline ship messages you, "You are among the Federation, yes? It was one of you bastards who opened the jump beacon in the first place!" They quickly jump away.
You contact the other ship, "Thank you for your assistance. It's good to know that not all of you foreigners are so barbaric. Take this as a reward."
The Crystalline ship hails you, "It's a good thing you came when you did. We appreciate the assistance. Please take this for your help."

The Crystalline ship messages you, "Thank you. We were not prepared for the savagery with which you aliens battle. We will give you one of our weapons if you intend on assisting our kind in the future."

event.name: CRYSTAL_FED_MV
event.text: There appears to be a fight going on nearby. A Crystalline border guard is chasing a small Federation ship!
It doesn't look like the Fed ship can stand much more pressure. You fly in and intercept the Crystalline ship.
With the Federation ship distracting the guard, you are free to continue on your mission.
"Thank you! We were sent here to try and recruit some Crystals to the Federation cause. We had no idea we would be received so poorly..." They transfer some excess materials for your trouble.
The ship looks battered and ready to break apart. You quickly move in to help rescue the survivors, but it looks like only one person made it. They offer to join your crew as thanks.

event.name: CRYSTAL_FED_DESERTER_MV
event.text: For a moment you assume it's a glitch, but no... you've found a rare Elite Federation military ship! They hail you and, after some probing, reveal that they deserted the Federation fleet and decided to hide among the Crystals, figuring there would be few other Federation ships here to find them.

You send over some supplies to help them on their way and in return they upload their flight plan to your computer, allowing you to map the sector! "The Federation fleet's still standing - get there while you can!"
Deserters cannot be tolerated. You open fire on the cowards - though it doesn't please you to do so. The Federation needs every soldier it can get.
You send them a friendly warning regarding the armada of Rebel ships pursuing you, and then get underway lest they catch you up.

event.name: CRYSTAL_REQUEST_MV
event.text: The moment you arrive you notice a Crystalline ship in the vicinity keeping its distance. They message you, "The 'Rebels' that are trying to hunt YOU down are creating havoc everywhere they go. Bah, we came here to escape this crap..."

"To minimize their impact on our people, we would like you to give them your flight path out of our sector. We would like to remain civil and are willing to pay you in 'scrap' for the increased danger it poses."
It was never your intention to lead the Rebels here, and frankly you could do with the scrap. The Crystalline ship immediately jumps off to inform the Rebels, leaving you with a fleet to outrun!

choice.text: Accept the scrap but give them false flight plans.
(Crystal Crew) Try to convince them of the importance of your mission.
(Sentinel Crew) Try to convince them of the importance of your mission.
(Ruwen) Convince them of the importance of your mission.

event.text: "Oh my. I didn't realize you were currently visiting this sector. Yes, I think we can make this work." The Crystals agree to give the Rebels falsified flight plans and give you a plentiful helping of scrap.

choice.text: (Decoy Buoys) Accept the scrap but give them falsified flight plans.

event.text: Your decoy buoys allows you to create very convincing flight plans. They accept it as true and give you the scrap. The deception may not be the most honorable tactic, but staying ahead of the fleet is your highest priority.
You apologize for the trouble you've brought them, but explain that you have no choice. They seem to understand, and break the comm link to set about preparing defenses.
Unable to interpret it themselves, the Crystalline beings assume your data will mean something to the Rebels. It should see the pursuing fleet taking a leisurely cruise before they get back on track.
They take one look at your fake telemetry and realize what you've done. They apparently do not take being lied to well - they immediately attack!

event.name: CRYSTAL_REQUEST_CONVINCE_SUCCESS
event.text: The sight of one of their own kind on your ship seems to reassure them. Seemingly convinced you have their interests at heart, they agree to mislead the Rebel fleet and hand you a small sum of scrap as well. This should give you some extra breathing room.

Your Crystal tries to convince them of the importance of your mission. They seem sympathetic, but decline your requests. "Your crewmember may speak the truth, but I wonder if they have seen just what the Rebellion has done here. Though perhaps this small gesture may help you in leaving this sector behind, hopefully taking that accursed fleet with them. May your travels here be safe."

event.name: CRYSTAL_HELP_DIG_MV
event.text: A large Crystalline ship is floating in space here. They hail: "Aliens?! How curious. We request your aid. We have men buried on a nearby planet and we must dig them out."

You do as you're asked and send a crewmember down to the planet to assist. They discover a massive Crystal excavation operation and it quickly becomes clear this is a task that will take days, not hours.

You're committed to both saving the Federation and upholding the principles it worked to maintain. Your crewmember will remain and make good on the promise - you still have a galaxy to save. They give you some supplies for your trouble.

The Crystalline captain contacts you urgently: "What is the meaning of this?! Had you no wish to aid us you might simply have declined, but THIS... is an insult!" He turns his massive ship on yours and you prepare to fight for your life.

You've made a commitment, and that still means something. You wait one jump cycle and then inquire with the Crystalline captain about the status of the operation. "We respect your strength. The operation will take one more cycle."

You're committed to both saving the Federation and upholding the principles it worked to maintain. Your crewmember will remain and make good on the promise - you still have a galaxy to save. They give you some supplies for your trouble.

The Crystalline captain contacts you urgently: "What is the meaning of this?! Had you no wish to aid us you might simply have declined, but THIS... is an insult!" He turns his massive ship on yours and you prepare to fight for your life.

Another cycle passes while the Rebel fleet draws ever nearer. You contact the captain again. "Alien Captain, your knowledge of our customs has most impressed us. Your crewmember is on their way back to you now, along with a token of our respect."

choice.text: (Temporal Manipulator) Use your system to try and increase the speed of the dig.

event.text: Having decided that waiting further would cause too many problems, you opt to use your Temporal Manipulator to speed up the excavation process. It's subtle, but your crewmember manages to finish up before the next cycle. The Crystals they were working with offer a reward for their hard work.

choice.text: (Adv. Temporal) Use your system to increase the speed of the dig.

event.text: You're not entirely sure how well this will work out, but you decide to use your exotic system to speed up the excavation process. Initially the Crystals involved are perplexed and a little worried at what seems to be happening, but they soon realize roughly what's going on and decide to take full advantage of it. The operation proceeds smoothly and the Crystals reward you handsomely for it.

choice.text: You have no crew to spare.

event.text: "We understand. You rely on machines for so much. Yours is a soft and weak species - we would hardly even have noticed your presence. Fly well."

event.name: DISTRESS_CRYSTAL_SICK_FIRE
event.text: There is a Crystal clinic at this beacon. Smoke is emerging from it, and the station is all gummed up with crystal lockdown. A medic hails you. "Help! We're trying to deal with a fire, but we can't move! One of our patients had a bad reaction to their Ryapel... We can't move as long as their lockdown is uncontrollable!" The fire doesn't seem to be too intense - if you act fast you can put it out before any more harm is done.

Your crew teleports onto the station and begins to put out the fire. The fire hasn't spread far, so your crew is easily able to save the spooked patients. "Whew. That was a close one. Thank you for saving the clinic. Unfortunately, the patient in question will still be difficult to treat in their current condition..."

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Offer to treat the lock-down prone patient.

event.text: Your crew is able to phase past the crystals and enter the clinic. The fire hasn't spread far, so your crew is easily able to save the spooked patients. "Whew. That was a close one. Thank you for saving the clinic. Unfortunately, the patient in question will still be difficult to treat in their current condition..."

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay + Teleporter) Offer to treat the lock-down prone patient.
(Jerry) Break down the crystal barrier and put out the fire.

event.text: Jerry blasts his way into the clinic like an action hero, blasting down the doors with his massive gun. The fire hasn't spread far, so your crew is easily able to save the spooked patients and put out the fire. "Whew. That was a close one. Thank you for saving the clinic. Unfortunately, the patient in question will still be difficult to treat in their current condition..."

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Offer to treat the lock-down prone patient.
(Paladin Crew) Break down the crystal barrier and put out the fire.

event.text: Your Paladin is able to break past the crystals and enter the clinic. The fire hasn't spread far, so your crew is easily able to save the spooked patients and put out the fire. "Whew. That was a close one. Thank you for saving the clinic. Unfortunately, the patient in question will still be difficult to treat in their current condition..."

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Offer to treat the lock-down prone patient.
(Recon Drone) Use your Recon Drone to break in and evacuate the clinic.

event.text: Your drone smashes the doors down with great efficiency and evacuates the sickly Crystals. The fire hasn't spread far, so the clinic staff are easily able put it out as the evacuation transpires. "Whew. That was a close one. Thank you for saving the clinic. Unfortunately, the patient in question will still be difficult to treat in their current condition..."

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Offer to treat the lock-down prone patient.
Your extinguisher system can't properly interface with the clinic in its locked-down state.
Break down the crystal barrier and put out the fire.

event.text: The clinic's fire starts to get out of control - a lot of patients are likely dying. You do your best to ignore this grim reality.

event.name: CRYSTAL_SICK_TREATMENT
event.text: Having moved the Crystal to your own ship, you're able to treat their condition. As the clinicians tell you, the patient had a bad reaction to their medicine. You're able to treat their symptoms and return them to the clinic. Before they leave, they offer you a piece of crystal technology for helping them.

No matter how you try, you're not able to make a dent. Unfortunately, the fire starts to go out of control - it is too late. The sick Crystals can't escape the inferno. There's nothing more to do here.
Eventually you break through the lockdown, but by the time you do, most of the patients have died. The Crystals are appreciative, but it's clear that they are grieving for the ones that passed.

Your crew are able to find a weak point in the crystals and break through before the fire spreads. All of the patients are able to be rescued. "Whew. That was a close one. Thank you for saving the clinic. Unfortunately, the patient in question will still be difficult to treat in their current condition..."

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Offer to treat the lock-down prone patient.

event.name: DISTRESS_CRYSTAL_VAGABOND_CONFLICT
event.text: You arrive at a scene of one Crystal ship fleeing from another. The pursuer is broadcasting on an open channel. "This is your final warning, pests! The Empire does not tolerate reappropriation of derelict ships!" The other ship desperately sends you a communique - a Ghost requests your help. "I beseech thee! Grant us thy aid!"
"Outsiders! You dare interrupt law enforcement within our borders? You will die for your insolence!" The Crystal switches its target to you instead of the Vagabond!
"Alas! Our fortune worsens!" The Vagabond is cornered between your ships! You seem to be in a better position to attack.

"Attention, belligerents! The Empress of the Crystals will agree to a peaceable compromise, with conditions. First and foremost: Vagabond ship, are the bodies of the Crystals who died still onboard?"
"...we have swept their remains into a corner." The Vagabond captain admits, sheepishly.
"Fine. We demand their remains, which will be enshrined within the Scintillating Mausoleum. Second condition: You must provide payment and a gift in exchange for the vessel. Once this is done, our patrol will escort you to the exit of our sector, and you may not return, under penalty of death."
The Vagabonds take a moment to discuss it, before agreeing to the terms.

"My empress! You are generous and wise. Will this be the new policy moving forwards?"
Dianesh shakes her head. "I'll adjust our foreign policy when I am done traveling the galaxy. For now, continue operating as you have." The Crystals offer their queen a small tribute.

choice.text: (Dessius) Convince the Vagabonds to turn over the ship.

event.text: Dessius belts a command to his people. "Thou art vastly too proud! Grant our rivals that which they lay sovereignty over. Surely thine lives measure greater worth than to expire here!" At this suggestion the Vagabonds give up the ship to the Crystals. As they leave their ship, one insists that they be allowed on yours!
"Federation, you have impressed us with your diplomatic acumen. No shots had to be fired due to your involvement. We offer a tribute in thanks for your assistance."
You decide not to interfere in the Empire's jurisdiction.
While you were fighting the Crystals, the Vagabonds seem to have taken the time to escape. There's nothing else you can do here.
The Vagabonds seem to have waited around for you. "We cannot express the depth of our gratitude!" One of their number pledges to join your cause.
The Vagabonds seem to have waited around for you. "We cannot express the depth of our gratitude!" They offer you a weapon... although it looks like it has seen better days.

event.name: DISTRESS_REFUGEE_CRYSTAL
event.text: You have encountered a refugee ship drifting in space. It looks as if it was fleeing the Rebel advance and ran out of fuel. Its distress beacon is active, but you're not sure anyone is on board.
You're wary of the refugees but figure it's safe to do something on the ship.
As you hail the refugee ship, a Crystal ship suddenly jumps into the system... it's clear the Crystals don't approve of their presence in this sector, and they don't approve of yours either!

event.name: QUEST_CRYSTAL_REBEL_ATTACK_ORCHID
event.text: As you arrive, you spot a Rebel pursuing a Gathering vessel. However, once the Rebel notices you, it breaks off to attack you instead!

event.name: CRYSTAL_ORCHID_SAVED
event.text: "You have done us a great service! Unfortunately, that Rebel attack killed the Crystal scout that was escorting us through the sector. We have a very important sociology conference to get to... do you think you could help us make it there?"
"Thank you kindly. I hope we can make it in time."
"We'll find another way, then. Hopefully a friendly Crystal will help us."

event.name: CRYSTAL_ORCHID_ESCORT_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Crystal sociology conference is happening here.

event.text: The Orchid vessel jumps in after you, pleased to have arrived at their conference. "Ah, we were wondering when you would arrive. The Empire has been very curious about the sociological insights of the Ctl'Yae. Thank you for guiding them here. You can stay for the conference if you'd like." As fun as it sounds, there is a mission to be done. However, they do allow you and your crew to sample some of the complimentary buffet. The Orchids also give you a gift.

event.name: CRYSTALHOME_ZOLTENVOY
event.text: It appears a brave Zoltan ship has pushed deep into Crystalline space, but their hull has received critical damage, with several massive breaches in the hull.

You board the ship, but it's already too late. A dying Zoltan in the corner manages to cough out some final words to you. "The Crystals- they were here... take this to them... You know what to do with it." The Zoltan slides over a package containing a large Zoltan-made bomb, and a letter noting some coordinates, then dissipates into nothing.
It's probably too late anyways, and not worth the effort. You ignore the Zoltan ship.

event.name: CRYSTALHOME_ZOLTENVOY_DELIVERY

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Coordinates of a Sentinel outpost given by a dying Peacekeeper.

event.text: You've arrived at the destination given to you by the Zoltan. A Sentinel vessel is guarding an outpost where a military operation appears to be run.

choice.text: Give them the bomb - the Zoltans must have been delivering this.
Detonate the bomb - the Zoltans must have wanted revenge for being attacked.

event.text: You don't know what the Zoltan wanted, but better not to get involved. You break down the bomb into some ammunition.

You hail the outpost and deliver the bomb. The Crystals inside are deeply confused, but not long after Zoltan reinforcements jump in! It seems you've misunderstood - the Zoltans were here to attack the Crystals! The peace-keeper vessel approaching seems to think you're working against them and attacks!

You hail the outpost and deliver the bomb. It appears you understood correctly, because the Crystals thank you. Whatever attacked the Zoltans must have been a pirate, probably using the Crystal weapons so commonly found around here. As thanks for finishing the delivery, the Crystals pay you handsomely.

You sneak into the outpost and place the bomb where it looks like it'll cause the most damage, then detonate it from a distance. It has a disastrous effect, and the Crystals are obviously not pleased. You hear them shouting, "Damn it, pirates must have taken out the envoy, and now they're attacking us too! Prepare for battle!" It seems you've misunderstood the Zoltan's intentions.

You sneak into the outpost and place the bomb where it looks like it'll cause the most damage, then detonate it from a distance. It has a disastrous effect, and the Crystals are obviously not pleased. But before they can send a ship to defend themselves, Zoltan reinforcements jump in and destroy their hangar, forcing the Crystals to surrender. The Zoltans recognize your help, and extend a reward.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_CRYSTAL
textList.text: You arrive near a fleet of Crystal ships, civilian or mercantile from the looks of them. You pause to scan one but they react immediately and send an escort to fight you off. Prepare to engage!

You arrive at the Beacon and are immediately greeted by an automatic message or warning of some kind. The translator can't seem to discern its purpose but after a few short moments an alarm goes off and a hostile ship jumps in!
You receive a message, "Hah. It looks like another worthless alien-filled craft. Prepare to meet your maker!" Weapon locks detected.
A Crystalline ship messages you, "I have not yet seen an Alien ship of such caliber as yours! As a warrior I demand to test my skills against you!" Before you can respond they move in to attack.

You arrive in a busy sector. At first no one pays any mind to your foreign ship but soon you're registering a number of scan signatures. You get the feeling you're not wanted here just seconds before registering enemy weapon locks!

You jump next to a node busy with traffic, but before long all nearby ships notice you and keep their distance, uncertain of your allegiance. After an awkward standoff, a military ship breaks away from the rest and charges you.

A barrage of rasps and clicks is broadcast over the comm; the universal translator understands little, but the words 'aliens', 'allowed' and 'no' come through quite clearly. You'll have to prove your right to be here in combat!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_CRYSTAL_STATION
event.text: A Crystal station nearby notices your ship. "We do not welcome outsiders here! Get out, now!" It appears they're willing to back their threats up with their weapons.

event.name: CRYSTAL_CONVOY
event.text: A large convoy of lumbering civilian ships appears to be passing through this region. You show no hostile intentions, but they are taking no chances, immediately sending their escort to attack!

event.name: CRYSTAL_HUNTER
event.text: Crystal shards fly past your ship as soon as you jump. You scan to find the assailant and discover a Crystalline ship carrying a number of humans in its cargo bay. It must be hunting the alien ships!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_CRYSTAL
textList.text: You see a Rebel ship approaching. "Ack, I can't tell if this sector is any worse than the time we were stationed in that Slug hellhole. Maybe if we kill you, we can finally be stationed somewhere nice!"
The Rebels haven't been pleased with the return of yet another alien race. A particularly agitated Rebel ship wastes no time locking onto you and attacking!
A Rebel ship, hot on your tail, approaches. Its weapons are armed and there's no doubt a fight is about to ensue.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ROCK_CRYSTAL
textList.text: A Rock fanatic, here to watch and study the Crystals, notices you. Thinking you've come to harm its idols, it attacks.
"You are not welcome here! This sector has been chosen by the gods, and you are intruding! We are their divine prophets, and we will remove you!"
A group of egotistical Rockmen hail you, claiming they have been chosen by the Crystals to destroy your ship.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_COALITION_CRYSTAL
textList.text: It appears you've had the misfortune of running into a Coalition ship travelling through this territory. They spot you almost immediately and attack!
A Coalition vessel is salvaging the remains of a nearby Crystal station. However, upon spotting you they quickly undock and attack!

textList.name: TEXT_NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_CRYSTAL
textList.text: It seems the Crystalline people have adjusted well to the nebulas found throughout the galaxy. A hunter hiding in the depths of the clouds here descends, weapons ready!
It makes sense for the Crystals, lovers of solitude, to take refuge deep in the nebulous clouds. A ship here, unhappy that you've disturbed them, attacks!
You spot a Crystalline vessel sneaking through the nebula. "Gah, I came here to escape you aliens! Now you chase us down?" It seems conflict is inevitable.
You aren't alone in this nebula. A Crystalline vessel approaches, ready to attack.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_CRYSTAL_MIRROR
event.text: The planet in the distance is rather bland, save for a few lakes and rivers. Curiously enough, that hasn't stopped a Crystal ship from docking next to a pond.

You find the captain of the Crystal ship kneeling besides one of the aforementioned ponds, staring deeply into it. When you ask him about his fascination, he replies: "Hello, Captain. Do take a look into the pond and tell me, isn't that the most beautiful creature you have ever seen in your life?" Expecting to see a water creature of some sort, you bend over and look, but all you can see is the reflection of the Crystal captain.

choice.text: (Nights) Nights is eager to answer that question.

event.text:
Still heavily drunk, Nights stumbles over to the pond, takes one look at the "creature", and erupts into manic laughter. "HAHAHAHAHA! You call that beautiful?? Ssssee, that ssslimy bassstard Sssslocknog, well he looksss ten times better than thisss, and my eyesss sssour jussst from glancing at him! Your sssense of beauty isss sssoo bad it makesss me wanna-"
Nights doesn't get to finish as he vomits straight into the pond, throwing up from all his excessive drinking. Horrified from both his words and the now disfigured "creature", the Crystal collapses on the spot.

choice.text: Call in the captain's crew so they can check on him.

event.text: Upon arriving at the scene, his crew conclude that their captain died immediately after fainting from the emotional damage. While the crew "mourn" their captain's death and return a little too excitedly to their ship, their second-in-command discreetly transfers some goods to you for helping them get off this planet.

Just before you head back to your ship, an Orchid Praetor taps you on your back. It seems they just appeared out of nowhere and have no recollection of their past, but they seem to be willing to work for you if it means they won't be stuck behind on this planet.
Who cares about sightseeing? We have better things to do.

"Isn't it so! I see you are beings with an eye for true beauty as I am. While I cannot bear to part with this magnificent creature, I wish to offer a token of my respect. My crew do not share the same appreciation that I do and are waiting impatiently in our ship. Perhaps they will serve your mission better."

"Isn't it so! I see you are beings with an eye for true beauty as I am. While I cannot bear to part with this magnificent creature, I wish to offer a token of my respect. Seeing that I will no longer require my equipment in search of a more beautiful place, please help yourselves to some of my tech."

"So these are fools who refuse to acknowledge true beauty! Hah, you aliens are as uncultured as you are barbaric. I do not wish to preside with you much longer, for I have a better companion. Isn't that right, my dear?" The Crystal goes back to gazing fondly at the pond. You decide to leave this weirdo behind.

"So these are fools who refuse to acknowledge true beauty! Hah, you aliens are as uncultured as you are barbaric. I now consider it my duty to rid the galaxy of such dirty foreigners. I'll be back in a moment, my sweet!"

"What?? How dare you say such a thing! I shall show you the true form of the creature!" You expect the Crystal to attack, but instead he dives into the pond, attempting to "bring up the creature". A few minutes pass, and all of a sudden an Orchid taps you on your back. It seems they just appeared out of nowhere and have no recollection of their past, but they seem to be willing to work for you if it means they won't be stuck behind on this planet.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_CRYSTAL_ELITE
event.text: Crystal Sentinels are the protectors of the Crystal sectors, and are much stronger than their civilian brothers. By entering into their new Homeworlds with a military-tier cruiser, the Crystal people have deemed you a threat worthy of the retribution of a Sentinel vessel!

event.name: CRYSTAL_SANCTUARY
event.text: You've discovered a massive Crystalline society, well furnished and protected. In the center is a small village surrounding a massive contraption... it looks like a gateway of some sort?

The contraption seems to resemble a much larger version of the Waystone, the device that the Crystalline people used to seal off their old homeworlds. As you approach, a massive Crystalline cruiser approaches, its weapons aiming straight at you!

A ceremoniously painted purple Crystal stands before you, far taller than those in the background. "I am Empress Dianesh Kryel. You... are a foreigner, and foreigners are unwelcome. The Federation has given us its aid, and for that we are grateful. But we are no longer in need of the Federation, and you need nothing of us. We shall negotiate terms."

"The terms on which you leave this place. Your presence here is not sanctioned. I know people like you. Ambassador Ruwen has told me the stories. You are barbarians, murderers. Renegades like you were the ones who first stole our home from us. And I refuse to allow such things to transpire again. I will satisfy whatever vain desires you might have to ensure you leave and never return. My people do not want you here."

Dianesh gestures for a small transport ship to approach and deliver a specialized Crystal weapon. "We have met your demands, now you will abide by ours and leave." You figure it's best not to press further and follow their instructions.

Dianesh gestures for a small transport ship to approach. It delivers a Crystalline prisoner, who eagerly joins your crew as long as it brings an end to their sentence. "We have met your demands, now you will abide by ours and leave." You figure it's best not to press further and follow their instructions.

Dianesh gestures for a support ship to come by and give a full repair. "We have met your demands, now you will abide by ours and leave." You figure it's best not to press further and follow their instructions.

choice.text: We did not come here to harm you. We are not as bad as you say.

event.text: "Oh but you see, only by making such claims do you prove your intentions. Were you of true heart, you would have already left. But you persist. Persistence is a threat. And my people do not take kindly to threats." You try to protest further but Dianesh will not listen. She waves and her cruiser moves forth to strike you down. This doesn't have to necessarily end in bloodshed, but the Crystals aren't going to listen easily.
Diving so deep into a Crystalline city is generally not a good idea. You distance yourself from the planet.

event.name: CRYSTAL_BOSS_DEFEAT
event.text: You have defeated the cruiser, and with it have killed the Crystalline empress. Though this can only spell bad news for the future, you content yourself with salvaging the remains of the ship.
This will no doubt only hurt the Crystalline people's views on foreigners, but it's too late to change it now. Perhaps, in a future reality, there might be a better way to resolve this...

event.name: CRYSTAL_BOSS_SURRENDER
event.text: The Crystal cruiser, and the crew on board, are on their last breath. The ship's engines flare as it rocks back and forth, barely able to keep up with you any longer.

You power down your weapons. A little while later, the Crystals do the same. Dianesh appears onscreen, breathing heavily with a long crack down her once smooth face. "So... so you have chosen mercy. I must say, I did not expect this..."
There will be no mercy for the Crystals, not today.

event.name: CRYSTAL_BOSS_MERCY
event.text: You land your ship nearby the city, guided by Dianesh. The large Crystalline being steps out of her battered cruiser and comes to face you.

"It seems I might have been misguided in my assumptions. You have... my most sincere apologies for this aggression. I am an honorable woman, and I have disgraced myself by attacking you. I will not have this be. With Ruwen away, there is no one but myself to offer their services to you. Maybe when this is through, we can see if there is a place for my people among the Federation..."
